sub_title: Technical costumer service manager open to opportunities worldwide
summary:
Senior Chemist with extensive experience in developing innovative and sustainable solutions within the plastics, coatings and membrane sectors. I am a strategic innovative thinker with excellent problem-solving skills and able to explore non-conventional ideas to find unique solutions. I am an enthusiastic communicator with good interpersonal skills and intend to grow to a leadership position. As a project manager I have developed crucial planning and organizational skills to deliver value and quality solutions to my employer. I love to work with people and be challenged with different perspectives. 
I am well-suited for jobs requiring team-working, a innovative mind-set, analytical ability and leading skills.I am willing to relocate worldwide.
I would like to pursuit a MBA to improve my business kills and to better impact my employee business.

Technical skills: 
Project management 
Good presentation and reporting English skills
Materials Science  and Chemical synthesis.   
Polymer chemistry and Polymer physics
Coatings and Paint 
Plastic and Thermoplastics composites formulation and processing
Catalysis
Product development
3D Printing
Biopolymers 
Membrane Technology and fluid dynamics
Corrosion of polymer composites and metal
Broad experience in materials characterization and standard testing.  
Lab HS&E

profile_positions.description:
•	Lead projects from requirements definition through deployment, identifying timings, scopes and project implementation plans, including risk mitigation.
•	Technical lead of different projects related to the development of innovative coating technologies including waterborne, solvent borne and low emission coatings technologies.
•	Planning and executing lab testing, as well as coaching others (chemical, mechanical and thermal characterization).
•	Develop and maintain partnerships with outside resources—including suppliers and researchers that can bring a competitive edge to AkzoNobel.
•	Presentation of project outcomes and/or risks to the appropriate management channels including R&D top managers, marketing and project stakeholders. 
•	Supervision activities and guiding of other AkzoNobel employees and interns.
•	Responsible for and co-organizer of company events as R&D colloquium, YAN.
profile_positions.title: Project manager & Senior Scientist R&D

profile_positions.description:
•      Optimization of a software fluid permeation modelling software with an external partner towards more accurate assessment on the product lifetime before failure which resulted increase customer satisfaction and product trust.
•	Responsible for writing and executing corrosion risk assessments for major oil and gas clients as Shell, Petronas and Saudi Aramco.
•	Keeping track of codes and standard for thermoplastic composite testing
•	Responsible for accessing 30+ different polymer raw materials for the successful introduction of 5 new products in collaboration with polymer suppliers. 
•	Keeping track of codes and standard for thermoplastic composite testing
•	Responsible for sales and customer support regarding corrosion and fluid compatibility issues and its effect on the pipe life and operation.
•	Chemical, thermal and mechanical characterization.
profile_positions.title: Materials Engineer

profile_positions.description:
• Lead researcher in R&D projects, including EU projects (e.g. Nanomasters). 
• Lead engineer on the development of different polymer and composite products, e.g. electrically/heat conductive polymer nanocomposites, reinforced thermoplastic materials with high strength.
• Consulting on processing optimization of thermoplastics/thermosets and polymer composites by injection and compression moulding, extrusion, FDM and SLS.
• Managing lab testing and responsible for lab safety and training. Responsible for chemical, mechanical, spectroscopy and thermal conductivity characterization. Shear, peal and fatigue adhesive testing and ageing tests.
• Involved in customer support activities.
• Searching funding opportunities and market opportunities with sales.
profile_positions.title: R&D, Polymer Specialist

profile_positions.description:
Membranes Technology Group at University of Twente, MESA+ Institute	
This project was sponsored by ISPT, Shell, AkzoNobel, ECN and Solsep.
	 	
•	•	A new class of organic solvent nanofiltration membranes was fabricated by chemically applying a thin polymer coating on porous ceramics.
•	Synthesis of ceramic supports and optimization of synthesis of inorganic sols.
•	Development of new routes for surface and pore modification of inorganic supports via multistep polymer synthesis reactions using different polymeric coatings by wet and vapour methods.
•	Evaluation of membrane performance for solvent filtration and gas separation. 
•	Project management. 
•	Coordinate internal and external resources within other research institutes and the industry stakeholders.
•	Responsible for the structural, spectroscopy and thermal characterization. Evaluation of membrane performance for solvent filtration and gas separation. 
•	Responsible for teaching lab courses and supervising BSc/MSc students.
•	Supervisor of students for industrial contract research for external companies, for example, the development of a good performance water repellent coating layer for a ceramic pressure sensor.
•	Crucial role in best practices for laboratory safety and equipment maintenance.
•	Scouting for new opportunities and responsible for setting up joint research projects and future funding. 

      Achievements:
•	A controlled functionalization by polymers of the internal pore surface of the inorganic material was achieved (e.g. chemical vapor deposition). This translated in applications beyond membrane systems e.g. sensors, coatings, resins.
•	Affinity based separation of solvent streams was achieved and new insights were gained in the transport mechanism of solvent. 
•	Solvent resistant nanofiltration membranes were developed and were tested at companies in a pilot scale (Solsep and Shell).
•	This pioneer project resulted in a new research lines for the research group, and consequently new funding.
profile_positions.title: Researcher PhD candidate

profile_positions.description:
Researcher at 3B’s group- Biomaterials, Biodegradable, Biomimetic, University of Minho, Portugal
Project: Thermal behavior of biodegradable polyesters for medical applications.
 
- Synthesis of polymer inclusion complexes by using biodegradable polyester and cyclodextrins for application in drug-delivery systems.
• Responsible for the synthesis  and characterization of  polymeric biomaterials e.g polymer gel solutions wit a proper rheological properties.
• Responsible for TGA, DSC and DMA testing for different materials including setting up experiments, testing, data analysis and reporting. 
• Spectroscopy, thermal, rheological and fracture mechanics characterization.

Achievements:
-	A polymeric material was successfully incorporated in cyclodextrins. This strategy results in a crystalline inclusion complex. Body temperature and pH response could be modulated. As a consequence these inclusion complexes have proven their potential as controlled drug-delivery systems.
-	Scaffolds with proper mechanical properties were synthesized.
profile_positions.title: Researcher, Bio-polymers
